conclusion: Shadows are formed when an object blocks light, creating a dark area on a surface.
The size and position of a shadow depend on the angle and distance of the light source relative to the object.
There are four objects: a pie, a carton, a calendar, and a baseball casting shadows A, B, C, and D.
Moving the light source forward means it is moving closer to the objects along the horizontal plane.
Shadow A (Pie) will move backward and may become shorter as the light source moves forward.
Shadow B (Calendar) will move backward and may decrease in size as the light source becomes more directly above.
Shadow C (Carton) will move backward and may become shorter due to the light source's new position.
Shadow D (Baseball) will move backward and may decrease in size as the light source moves forward.
As the light source moves forward, shadows A, B, C, and D will move backward and likely decrease in size.
